page.title: 16HEALTH IN HOLTON-LE-CLAY
page.content: The{Health Centre}in Holton-le-Clay is on Tetney Lane. There are six rooms, two actual surgery rooms, two examination rooms, one treatment room and one waiting room. The largest room is the waiting room. The Health Centre is{open five days a week,}but not on Wednesday mornings or Thursday nights. Doctors get six weeks holiday a year, the other staff get only four weeks. There are{3 doctors, 2 men and 1 {woman.}There is a health visitor, a caretaker and a secretary. The busiest day is a Monday. They have about{160 {patients per week.}They do not treat any broken arms or legs because they need to be x-rayed. There are 2 or 3 patients over 80 years old. The doctors deliver about{8-10 babies a {month.
